Q&A

From:
24 Oct 2016

In the Building Code V1.0, values related to wind and snow loads and earthquake-resistant intensity have been crossed out. Would you please give us the correct values for the city of Dezhou?

#Building Code #Team JIA+

20 Oct 2016

Do we need to equip appliances that are daily necessities but not mentioned in Rules, for instance, electric kettles, induction cookers, etc.

#Design #Team THU

20 Oct 2016

Do we have to determine the location of water supply and drainage on site?

#Site #Team THU

20 Oct 2016

Part of our Design Development can not be completely finished. For instance, the manufacturer, product model of some of our facilities have not been decided. Can we leave these information blank?

#Design #Team THU

20 Oct 2016

Does the municipal pipe system provide fire demand, or we need to equip our own fire water tank?

#Site #Team THU

14 Oct 2016

We need the meteo data of Dezhou to design precisely the project.

#Design #Team JIA+

27 Sep 2016

Can you please provide the table of contents/what's expected of the Design Development to be submitted on 18th Nov 2016?

#Rules #Team Shunya

26 Sep 2016

What are the accessibility requirements for the homes? If we have a 2 storey unit, do we need an elevator?

#Building Code #Team Toronto

26 Sep 2016

Is the concrete pad above grade? If it is, does it count towards the 8m solar envelope?

#Site #Team Toronto

26 Sep 2016

We intend on submitting a request for a house power supply of 240V, 60Hz. And in Canada, we only use single-phase.

#Building Code #Team Toronto

26 Sep 2016

Are there any limits of the number of trucks that can be parked in the parking area of the construction site?

#Site #Team SCUT-POLITO

21 Sep 2016

According to the Building Code are we allowed to use EPS/XPS insulation in the building's exterior walls? If yes are there any limitations we need to know about?

#Building Code #Team Shunya

18 Sep 2016

Contest 10.2 will restrict the application of PV panel and solar energy. We want to make sure that Contest 10.2 will be the final rule or we need to change our strategy.

#Rules #Team SCUT-POLITO

News

25 Oct 2016

Prof. Yin, on behalf of the SDC Organizing Committee, visited Team SJTUIUC at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

20 Oct 2016

Headed by Prof. Fisch, solar decathletes from Technische Universität Braunschweig interacted with their Chinese partners at Southeast University in Nanjing.
